Reviews.Title: “Amazing Terrace View”
Reviews.Author: DDSgadabout
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over Easter weekend and were very happy with the hotel. The front desk staff were very friendly and we got a complimentary bottle of wine at check in. We loved enjoying the wine and appetizers and watching the sun set on the Blue Mosque from the terrace -- we made sure to go up on the roof every evening. The terrace views are magnificent! I am a very light sleeper and the call to prayer in the morning never woke me up. The room was very clean and the bathroom was a normal size as far as European bathrooms go. I thought the hotel was a little pricey (but it was probably because it was a holiday weekend). I would definitely recommend this hotel especially during the warmer months when the terrace is open. If I was in Istanbul over the winter I might choose a less expensive hotel since the best part of the hotel is the terrace and it's not open during the winter; however, maybe the prices go down a bit in the winter... The Blue House is a wonderful place to stay! We loved our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and views”
Reviews.Author: Bluebell_dream
Reviews.Content: We spent a week-end here with my husband on holiday who is actually Turkish, I don't think you could get a better location! The hotel is right near Sultanhamet and opposite the Blue Mosque. Worth getting the lift to the top floor and having a coffee/drink on the terrace as you plan your sightseeing and take some photographs as we did, the views overlook the Blue Mosque and Bosphorus and are wonderful both in the day and at night. Walking distance to the bazar across the street where there are lovely shops selling hand made arts and crafts, carpets etc and lively bars where you can sit and watch the whirling dervishes in the evening. The breakfast in the hotel has a huge choice, there is a free computer for your internet needs at reception and all the hotel staff were extremely friendly and welcoming! We would like to return again one day, perfect hotel which made our stay even lovelier, we never had to ask for anything, it has everything you need and has a boutique feel to it. Room was on the small side but quiet and as there is so much to see, we hardly spent anytime in it at all and the location, staff and breakfast etc made up for it! Thank you again, I can't recommend this hotel enough!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bogeysue
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, wonderful location, helpful staff, good food, outstanding view from roof top!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: AishahMoors
Reviews.Content: THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU for a great 5-nights stay for our family at your hotel. Travelling with 2 elderly parents and 2 young children is always challenging but your staff have made it so simple and do-able for us. It feels like a small family house :) You've also been so helpful, especially when our parents were not well. Alhamdulillah we are safe and sound at home in Doha, Qatar. Location-wise, there are lots of beautiful things so close by and it's the centre of the tour in Istanbul! Food-wise, they serve very simple yet OK food but there are lots of great restaurants around the hotel. InshaAllah, we will be back there one day! Highly recommended Blue House Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “very convenient comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: SEDLondonUK
Reviews.Content: As other reviews have said, this hotel is right by the main attractions but on a quiet street. The rooms are fine and the terrace wonderful. Staff reasonably helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: david s
Reviews.Content: Our tour (Argeus) booked us at this hotel, and we were very happy with it. Its location is ideal, almost across the street from the beautiful Blue Mosque, and very close to a little bazaar. Our room was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “service par excellence”
Reviews.Author: Ralph C
Reviews.Content: Not only was this hotel all the things that previous reviews have quoted, the friendly and efficient service from the assistant manager and the front desk manager exceeded our expectations and made our stay and our 'after stay' experience exceptional. When we got home, my husband found that he had left his favorite cap in the hotel room. He decided to e-mail and see if it had been found. (I said "good luck, buddy".) Lo and behold it had and was mailed to us immediately. Combined with location, food and accommodation, the excellent service makes the Blue House a perfect choice for a stay in Istanbul. Ralph and Mary

Reviews.Title: “The Best Choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: brushford
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located near to the Blue Mosque, The Artisan Market etc. Despite the fact that the rooms are small the hotel is spotless. This is my second stay there and won't be my last. The staff were friendly and always there to assist you. The Breakfast could be improved but still good - very good yoghurt!! I cannot fault this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: AdventureRUs
Reviews.Content: For first time visitors, the location is perfect. You can walk to the major sites in 5 minutes which is a real plus in this fabulous city. We stayed both at the beginning of our trip and again at the end, both times appreciating just how easy it was to get around. The view from the outdoor rooftop was so beautiful, we had to look one more time before our departure. Rooms are small but this is one city where you are not going to want to stay in your room. We were booked by the fantastic Argeus Tours for their marvelous Classical Turkey Tour and were so happy to be so conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: Hollyluja
Reviews.Content: Expensive, but nice. Good breakfast, location, rooms

Reviews.Title: “Blue House is a Great House”
Reviews.Author: TerryGranade
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Blue House Hotel 7-10 Sept2011.The hotel is great for those that don't want palace size rooms. There were 3 couple's and we were treated wonderfully. It's across the street from the Blue Mosque and around the corner two blocks from the Hagia Sophia. Arrived on 7 Sept around 11:30 AM, were in our room's by 2PM. King size beds, 2 doubles pushed together. Better than a double, with small but functional bathrooms. The room service was excellent and the A/C worked! The front desk was helpful acquiring extra pillows for my wife and I. The breakfast, European continental, was ready by 6:45 daily. The server setting up the breakfast, had my ice bucket and large glass ready each morning, for ice tea. The view from the roof restaurant was fantastic. While on tour on Friday with a guide we had lunch at the "Pudding Shop". Our guide explained the owner also owns the Blue House Hotel. He was working the cash register. I went back after a great lunch and commented how pleased we were with the hotel. He asked for my room number and upon our return that evening a bottle of Merlot was waiting for us in our room. How great is that! On the back street of the hotel is a street with 2 blocks of great restaurants, easily missed. On the way is a minimart with cigs, wine, whiskey, etc. There's a laundry out the main door to the right at the end of the block turn left and on the left. Good job, fast, less expensive than the hotel. I would stay at the Blue House Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for seeing the main sights of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: CassieSurreyEngland
Reviews.Content: This friendly,clean ,delightful ,small hotel with a big heart made our stay in Istanbul. We stayed for 4 nights and as it is situated in the heart of Sultanahmet it was so easy to visit all we wanted to see. Ask at desk if you want to visit seafood restaurants and they will arrrange a restaurant to pick you up and take you back free of charge. Good food and fun night. Our room was small but very clean. Bathroom with shower small but again clean. The staff were very friendly and most helpful. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: phelder2006
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located near to the blue mosque and several other attractions in Sultanahmet neighborhood. The hotel is ok, with rooms and services compatible with the prices. If you wanna a luxurious hotel, choose another, but if you think that hotel is just a place to sleep and take a shower, so go ahead!

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay at the Blue House Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kencare99
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. It is attractive both inside and out and the rooms are roomy and lovely. The staff, from the Desk clerks and porters to the waiters on the Rooftop terrace were professional and enjoyable to talk to. In the lobby, they have a very secure facility and procedures for storing your valuables such as cash, jewelry and passports. For dinning at the hotel, they have a lovely Rooftop terrace with linen on linen and quality service. When it came to questions about the surrounding area and attractions, the Desk clears were most helpful. There were NO surprises such as being put in a room that should be labeled a closet as opposed to a room. At a cost of â‚¬ 140 per night and a $$-to-â‚¬â‚¬ exchange rate of $1.44, it was very reasonably priced for the quality of the staff and accommodations. Speaking to the staff in English was not a problem. My wife and I could not say enough good things about this hotel and I would recommend this hotel to my friends - 7/6/2110.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location. First Rate Place.”
Reviews.Author: mrfoxycat
Reviews.Content: This is a Very Nice, Excellent Hotel. Stayed Here for Several Days Mid-July and Was Very Happy and Satisfied With the Hotel, Central Location and Services. First Rate Place. Centrally Located in Sultanahmet, which is A Great Location. Can't be Beat. Literally Right Across from the Blue Mosque, Which is Absolutely Amazing to See At Night. It will Take Your Breath Away. Simply Look Out the Window or Just Step Outside the Front Door of the Hotel and There is It. Right in Front of You. Can't Top that! The Famed and Must See Hagia Sophia is a Short Walk Away. Also Very Nice to Walk Around the Neighborhood and See the Shops, Get A Sense of Atmosphere and What Turkey is Really Like. Literally Right Across the Street from the Hotel was A Really Nice Outdoor Restaurant that Had Exceptional Food, Great Atmosphere and A Twirling Dervish Dancer that Was Absolutely Amazing to Watch as He Spun Around for At Least 30 Minutes. It was Mind Blowing to Watch, Eat there and Take in the Tremendous Turkish Atmosphere, Great Smells of Grilled Specialties in the Air, Music and People Watch. Room Was Fine, Met Our Needs Very Well. Staff Very Helpful, Pleasant, Service Oriented and Very Accommodating. Breakfast Was Great, Ample Amount of Everything and it was Really Nice to Sit Outside on the Terrace and Take in the Early Morning Istanbul Atmosphere. We Also Had Lunch on the Rooftop Terrace of the Hotel which was Very Good, Great Service and Mind Blowing Views of Istanbul. A Must if You Stay at this Hotel. Would Highly Recommend and Would be Very Happy and Eager to Stay Here Again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: NYadvisor22
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in the beginning of July. This hotel is located in the most touristy area of Istanbul â€“ Sultanahmet which is the Old City. Some people try to avoid staying in this area but I think it was a great place to be. Youâ€™re steps away from the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia, which are both really great sites to see. This hotel is only a 10 min walk to the tram which will take you to any area you want to go to. The rooms were very nice and comfortable. I think this hotel should be listed as a 3 star hotel though. I think ive seen it listed as 4 stars on some sites. The staff were very accommodating and helpful and made any and all arrangements we needed. Breakfast was included in our package which was quite tasty. All in all we got a very homely vibe from this hotel and I would stay there again. As far as the sights go --- Youâ€™re about a 20 min walk (or a 5 min tram ride) from the Grand Bazaar which you must go to! Itâ€™s a huge indoor bazaar where you can get all sorts of Turkish goods. Try to go before 3pm so you have a better chance of negotiating. Although we went to the Topkapi Palace I wasnâ€™t that impressed with it. They show you old jewels and clothes that the Sultans wore but it wasnâ€™t for me. We never ended up going to the Basilica Cistern although we heard it was cool. The spice bazaar was OK. I think the grand bazaar was better because you can actually buy stuff from there. Unless youâ€™re interested in buying spices, I donâ€™t think there is much of a point to go here. Unfortunately we didnâ€™t do the Bosphorus Cruise because we didnâ€™t have enough time but we heard it would have been a wonderful experience. You should definitely try to go to a Turkish Bath while youâ€™re there. Its an experience, to say the least. You get taken to a hot stone where you lay in a room that is like a sauna and then someone will come and bathe you and scrub you down. Its definitely awkward, but only for a few mins. Its one of those things you must do if youâ€™re in Turkey. We didnâ€™t use a tour guide for Istanbul and I donâ€™t think you need to use one at all. Its an easy city to navigate throughout and when you walk and travel throughout the city on your own you get to experience more. However, when you go to the Hagia Sophia I highly recommend you take a guide up on their offer to explain the history of the mosque to you. It is one of the most beautiful sights of Istanbul and there is such a great history there. We went in without a guide and immediately realized how essential a guide would be for this site, so we hired someone that approached us. As far as meals go â€“ it is known that restaurants in Sultanahmet donâ€™t offer great food, so try to avoid that area if you can. We had a great meal at â€œ360 Istanbulâ€� which I highly recommend. We really enjoyed smoking hookah at the hookah bars that are all around Istanbul, especially Taksim Square. We also enjoyed hookah in the outdoor restaurant which was right outside of the Blue House hotel. Nightlife â€“ You MUST go to Reina. This club was unbelievable. Im from New York City and ive been to clubs in many cities throughout the country and the world but Reina was a crazy experience. It was vegas status. You wont regret it!! by the way, because this hotel is close to the Blue Mosque, you may be woken up by the early morning prayer call. It caught us by surprise! We stayed in Istanbul for 3 days and 3 nights. I would say that was enough. Itâ€™s the kind of city that you can stay at longer and youâ€™ll find stuff to do. But if you want to just quickly check out all of the main attractions and enjoy the city for a bit, then 3 days is enough After our Istanbul stay we headed to Cappadocia and stayed at 40da Cave Suite, so check out my review for that if youâ€™re interested!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Aussierosie21
Reviews.Content: Rooms although small were pleasantly decorated and very clean. Staff were very attentive. Breakfast was above Turkish standard, it offers more than picked cucumbers and boiled eggs! My coffee cup was refilled before I asked. It was cool when we were there but breakfast on the terrace would be gorgeous in summer. The roof top restaurant/ bar was a gorgeous place to end the day overlooking the floodlit Blue Mosque. This hotel is so centrally located you can walk to everything. This little hotel was a lovely place to stay and I would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: oliverpd
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Blue House while visiting Istanbul. It is conveniently located near all the big sights like the Blue Mosque and Ayasofya and a lot of well rated restaurants. Our room was clean and comfortable and quiet. The service was excellent. They have a roof-top terrace where they serve dinner. My wife and I had dessert and a raki on the terrace which had a great view of the Blue Mosque lit up at night. The tram/metro is a short distance away for visiting further away sights.

Reviews.Title: “Blue by name, Blue by nature”
Reviews.Author: dojies
Reviews.Content: The minimum that I am willing to accept is a clean room, a bedside table on either side of the bed, and a reading lamp on the table. This hotel fails on two of the three minimum conditions. Both my wife and I wear glasses and taking them off is the last thing that I do at night, and the first thing we do in the morning. I am not prepared to stumble in darkness from a table elsewhere in the room. Yes, they did provide it eventually but after asking twice. It was also nice to know that the air conditioner had been granted independence at the same time as the country. It did not necessarily operate under the command of the wall control. Their internet connection also enjoyed a similar freedom, sometimes being strong, but more frequently very weak resulting in having to reconnect. Almost not worth the effort. There is a PC available in the foyer. The hotel was described as â€œcharmingâ€� and â€œold charm.â€� Is this a euphemism for shabby? The leather sofa on the 4th floor is coming apart and was repaired amateurishly. Other furnishings are in need of updating. The rooms are small. The bathroom is small and cramped although the shower cubicle was comfortable for a big man. Location was good, although not being familiar was the city, I can not speak for other areas. May be it is better to live in the new city and take transport to Topkapi and the Mosque. Lots of eating houses in the area. The view of the Blue Mosque from the upstairs balcony was fantastic, especially as the sun is setting with a backdrop of a semi-darkened sky. Possibly worth sneaking into the hotel just for a photograph. The hotel lift does not have any doors and would really think twice about taking children there. Actually I would think twice about taking myself there again. Possibly not the fault of the management, but they were building across the road. Goods were being delivered at 3:00am together with all the shouting that often accompanies men on a construction site. Less than ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with spectacular view and exceptional staff!”
Reviews.Author: myronkathy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just beautiful, very clean and comfortable with a wonderful view of the Blue Mosque. Our room was tastefully decorated with a full ceramic tiled bathroom and excellent bedding. It was very clean and relaxing. The breakfast buffet was delicious and had a great variety to choose from. We enjoyed several meals in the restaurant just off the lobby. The food was delicious. There is also a lovely roof top restaurant for the summertime! We spent time on the side patio, a perfect place to enjoy a cup of tea and plan our day. The full service lounge/bar was always open and staffed with friendly people who were very helpful and interesting. The location is excellent and within walking distance of "everything"! Can't wait to return... we had a wonderful trip thanks to the staff at Blue House Hotel. Thank you all.

Reviews.Title: “what a wonderfull place to be”
Reviews.Author: microdante
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our sweetest weekend ever in Blue House (istanbul) last month. It located in excellent with a few steps to the Old City (Blue mosque-sultanahmet square). The room was nice, clean, large and had a well-equipped . Staying here, we were looked after so well with a nice staff. They offered nice rooms, great meals, full services and always ready to meet all our requirement. We were extremely relaxed when staying here. Such a wonderful friendly host. Thanks Blue House, we would come back again in near future.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGirl20
Reviews.Content: The Blue House Hotel in Istanbul is precious and the location is ideal. Our room overlooked the Blue Mosque and we were within walking distance of many historic landmarks and fabulous restaurants. The staff was friendly and helpful. Thank you for sharing your world with us. Joyce and Kathy, USA.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cheekablue
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel that's within easy walking distance of the major sites, but also close to lots of restaurants, then this is a good choice. Our room looked out onto the Blue Mosque which was great except for the call to pray at 5am! However that only lasts a minute and you can always go back to sleep. Our standard room was small but perfectly formed and all we needed. Staff were helpful and friendly. Breakfast was ok - again, all you need and you're not paying 5 star prices. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “SHAME OF THE BRAND”
Reviews.Author: fcamlica
Reviews.Content: Imagine a hotel has lots of good review and centally located in the middle of the Sultanhamed but then they serve coffe creams off the dates and tey think this will bring them profit.. Sham on the management of Blue House...

Reviews.Title: “Great view & location, good value, recommended.”
Reviews.Author: browdl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the suite for one night upon arrival in Istanbul. The view of the Blue Mosque is unbeatable â€“ double bay windows looking directly at the mosque. The windows can open if you want to get a clear view or the mosque or to hear the call to prayer. The suite was reasonably spacious and very clean, the bed and linens modern and comfortable. The staff was helpful in providing directions to nearby sights. We ate dinner in the terrace restaurant, which was thoroughly acceptable and notable due to the magnificent view. Breakfast was served at street level outdoors, and was satisfying and included further good views of the mosque. Overall, we liked the Blue House and would stay in the suite again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in the world!”
Reviews.Author: jonteller
Reviews.Content: This medium sized hotel manages to combine the slickness of a five star with te friendliness and warmth of a family hotel. It's location is perfect with views of the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus from the bedroom window and the terrace. Everywhere you would want to go is within easy walking distance. The staff, from the opening moment are warm, welcoming and efficient. Great selsection for breakfast it's just...great!! If ever I am in Istanbul this is the place I would most want to go to.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place to Stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Turkeyadmirer
Reviews.Content: As my husband and I have traveled many times in Istanbul, we have found that the Mavi Ev is the only place for us. It is situated in the historic district of Sultanahmet. You are close to the Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazaar. The service is wonderful. The employees are there to help you with smiling faces. We see the same faces year after year. The hotel is impeccable. It is soooooooooo clean. The view from the hotel is wonderful as well. The bedding is very comfortable. The rooms are safe and secure. The morning breakfast is very nice and great selections. The servers are waiting on you immediately. Dinner on the terrace is breathtaking!!!! The food is great. I can not say enough about this wonderful hotel. If you do not consider the Mavi Ev, you are definitely missing out. If you visit Istanbul, one of the hottest places to visit according to National Geographic Traveler, you definitely need to check this hotel out. :):)

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Freeblood
Reviews.Content: Situated just afront of Sultanahmet Mosq, owned by a Turkish famous familly, this Hotel makes you feel at home, and you need no guide to discover the entourage cause evrything is at your sight

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: cyprusbeachgirl6
Reviews.Content: Hotel: it's very close to every historical sight and within walking distance to the Bazaar and the spice market. The rooms are very small and the beds are not so comfortable though how much time is really spent in your room is the question that needs to be asked. My only complaint again is traveling overseas , has no one heard of a wash cloth ? The rooms are very clean and the maid service was done on a daily basis. One great thing was the bath cloth was huge for what we had seen at other hotels. Roof Top Terrace: Great view of the Blue Mosque and other sights though the food is not that good and very expensive. I would suggest going up there for a cold drink and not to eat anything since there is better food to be found on the other streets among Istanbul. The other thing that I found very distasteful was having the waiter stand over us because he wanted a bigger tip and actually said that. That left a bad taste in my mouth for the whole meal which was around 98 TL for 3 people. Staff : The staff was nice sometimes and grumpy other times. I wouldn't say they went out of their way. They do have free internet though only one computer and they don't offer any free shuttles anywhere in the city so you are on your own. Breakfast was a nice buffet with the price of the room with fresh fruit, cheese, bread, eggs, bad coffee( they have nescafe ) and other items which I though was a very nice selection. I'm not sure I would stay here again though I would recommend it to a friend due to its location and the price was right. Next time I would splurge for a hotel with a pool. Easy city to figure out and transit is great in the city which is nice when there are so many things to see.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great staff, great service in the heart of Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerfromMarin
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a clean, well run, small hotel in the center of the Instanbul, pick this place. The view from our room was incredible - the Blue Mosque. We wre within easy walking distance of all the major historical attractions, dining, evening entertainment and shopping. They even accomodated our 13-year old by adding an additional bed, and putting the 2 twins together for my husband and I. The lobby and the rooms are very clean with well appointed furniture. The bathrooms are a bit tiny, but very clean. The staff was great - everyone from the person who took our reservation, to the guy who stayed at the airport for over an hour waiting for us to get through the visa process, to the front desk, cleaning person and waiters all were very helpful, courteous and helped make our stay in Instanbul fantastic. I'd definitely recommend the Blue House!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are small but the location is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: lorraine934
Reviews.Content: A friend and I just spent a couple of weeks in Turkey and stayed here twice. The first time we got a corner room with a view and lots of windows. We were there several nights so it was great. The second time we were only there for one night and got a smaller room with no view at all. Be careful of the non-corner rooms. The hotel is clean, the bathrooms are tiny but very functional, and the staff is very pleasant. Each evening we would come back from where ever and have a glass of wine on the terrace overlooking the Blue Mosque. Gorgeous!! The breakfast was excellent and the internet access very convenient. I highly recommend it, and preferred it to the the Cirigan Kempinski (our last night) which was expensive and not as well located.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended if going with family or friends”
Reviews.Author: Hash76Yorkshire
Reviews.Content: I and my friend went to Istanbul and we absolutely loved it, the blue house hotel is in an ideal location straight outside the blue mosque, we had a really good view of the blue mosque & the marmaris sea from my room. We didnâ€™t stay in the hotel much because we were out and about visiting museums and shopping etc. But I would definitely recommend this hotel The reception area is nice. Theyâ€™ve got good sofaâ€™s ï�Š

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff,”
Reviews.Author: jimmyt7
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 5 nights in November 2009 and thought it was a great place. Its easy to find, the staff are very friendly and helpful and its in a great location. The room was very clean when we arrived and the maids did a good job every day keeping it that way. As some other reviewers have said the standard twin/double rooms are a little small but this did not bother us at all. We had a few small gripes such as non working lights, a TV that didnt have any watchable channels and the cold water going off for a couple of hours in the middle of the day. However as none of these things actually affected us directly (there were enough lights that did work and we didnt really want to watch the TV etc.) they was of no concern. We pre-booked and saved a bit on their standard intenet price (we paid just under 62 euro's a night) if we had paid the full price (85 euro's) we might have been disappointed. Breakfast was included and again was very good. A selection of teas, coffee and fruit juices. Fresh fruit and yoghat, fresh bread, cheese and hams. Eggs and other hot items. Cerials were also available. Plenty certainly for getting you thorugh a mornings sightseeing. The roof ternace was closed (as it said it would be on their website) which was a shame as the views were amazing (we sneaked out for a look). Still the price of drinks, actually the most expensive we found in the whole city, meant you would want to slip them slowly if you did get out there.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint boutique in great historic location”
Reviews.Author: Tycon
Reviews.Content: This is a quaint, small boutique hotel in the historic Sultanamit area of Istanbul right opposite the blue mosque. Location is perfect for those interested in the historic attractions of the city. Although a fairly basic establishment, service is friendly and efficient with clean rooms. There is one "suite" of sorts and I can recommend it for facilities and a wonderful view. I have stayed here twice and have enjoyed a different experience.

Reviews.Title: “Totally at Home at the Blue House”
Reviews.Author: LizBChicago
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mavi Ev, or Blue House Hotel for 3 nights and loved it! It's small enough that the people at the front desk know you after a day. The room was on the small-ish side, but completely adequate and the VIEW more than made up for any sacrifces in spaciousness. The Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara right out our window - fantastic! Beds were comfy, minibar was stocked with free water and well-chilled Coke Light, beer and other drinks. The bathroom was gorgeously tiled (small, but fine). Breakfast, included in our rate, was a delight - fresh breads, fruit, traditional Turkish items like fresh tomatoes, cucumbers, olives and white cheese and really good scrambled eggs. All in all, I would strongly recommend this for anyone, especially if you want to stay in Sultanahmet to see the sights - the location cannot be beat. You do get the call to prayer every morning at 5:15, but it's kind of cool, so I didn't mind it - reminds you that you are in a very forgein country.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: HenryAUS
Reviews.Content: The Hotel's location in Sultanahmet is very convenient to the Blue Mosque and the Haghia Sophia. Unfortunately President Obama wanted to visit these places as well, and for that particular morning the whole area was fenced off and restricted. The Police presence on that day was impressive! The breakfast available at the hotel was very good, and the rooftop dining area has excellent views, especially at sunset. The staff were always friendly and helpful. Also the free internet in the lobby was greatly appreciated. The rooms are small, but typical of older Ottoman style Hotels in the area. The fold-up bed provided for our tall teenage son (in our triple room) was poor, but I think the Hotel is set up mainly for doubles. If you love hearing amplified prayer calls as a morning wake-up alarm, this is the Hotel for you! We enjoyed this as part of the cultural experience, but it may not suit everyone. Overall, the hotel's location is very convenient to some tourist must-see places, but if you want bigger rooms, or a cheaper Hotel, there are many others to choose from. We found the little cafe on your left, (past the bazaar entrance steps as you walk uphill to the park), is excellent value for meals.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Happycamper1961
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic location for tourists in Istanbul. A stone's throw to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topkapi. The roof top terrace had perfect views of these attactractions and the Sea of Marmara and glimpes of the Bosphrus. Not the cheapest hotel around (esp. in high season) but well worth the cost. The tram line is about 2 minutes walk away and lots of fantastic restaurants on the same block (on the downhill side) and plenty of shopping all around. Friendly staff and a good restaurant. The rooms are on the small side, but no more so than the normal hotel in an old town centre. The Java Studio across the side street is a great coffee shop.

Reviews.Title: “Superior value, location, friendliness, charm, and spotlessly clean”
Reviews.Author: Melindabean1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Blue House for several years, and each time it looks as fresh as when it was new. The location is the best and the staff is wonderful. The rooms are somewhat small, as are the baths, but everthing is kept in beautiful condition. There is a wonderful breakfast and a very pleasant dinning area inside, and weather permitting, outside. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to be in the historic center of Istanbul. It is a great value and satisfactory in everyway. CML Atlanta, GA. USA

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was uniformly excellent!”
Reviews.Author: can_travel07
Reviews.Content: You could not improve on the location. The view of the Blue Mosque from our hotel room on the third floor was stunning. The hotel staff exceeded our expectations. They helped us book a tour to Ephesus and gave us advice about the location of surrounding attractions. Our room was very well appointed. The food was exceptional. We really appreciated the free internet in the lobby. My grandfather and I will recommend this hotel to all of our friends in Canada who travel to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: dukedad
Reviews.Content: What can I say that others haven't? The Blue House was wonderful. The hotel staff was fantastic, handling our check-in efficiently when we arrived late at 2:00AM. The rooms were typically European, a bit on the small side (but we had three beds in ours) but beautifully decorated, with fresh, crisp linens, clean floors, bed covers and so on. Very nice sitting area and bar downstairs with a separate computer (with internet) for customer use, and an absolutely wonderful breakfast and dining area. The breakfast was exceptionally diverse and plentiful, one of the best during our stay in Turkey. But the location of the Blue House makes it a "must stay" -- literally 150 meters from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, and maybe 250 meters to the nearest tram stop. Everything of importance is located nearby and within walking distance (in good weather). Fantastic stay -- great rooms, hotel staff, breakfast, location, all at a reasonable (for Istanbul) price.

Reviews.Title: “Has it all”
Reviews.Author: Give_Me_Travel
Reviews.Content: Blue House is in such a brilliant location in Sultanahmet that you would forgive any minor hotel niggles...but how great that weary (and one pregnant) traveler didn't have to! The rooms were perfect (a little small in the bathroom perhaps), clean, well appointed and had stunning views of the Blue Mosque just over the road. Breakfast, included in the tariff, was the best we had in Turkey - a lovely spread of all things local from sensational tomatoes, olives and fluffy Turkish bread to dried fruits, local honey, hot local pastries, yoghurt, juices coffee and tea. Yum! Just what you need for day of exploring Topkapi Palace, Aya Sofia and the Grand Bazaar. The porters were very attentive and helpful with our bags and umbrella on the day it rained. Reception staff were very nice, although perhaps a little shy. English was well spoken by everyone there. The call to prayer at dawn from the Mosque was quite loud being so close, but it doesn't last long and is all part of the marvelous experience of staying in Sultanahmet. Go - Blue House is great..

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst rooms i have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: petertwyman
Reviews.Content: My friend offered me to read the reviews of the hotels in tripadvisor.com so i have found the hotel and contacted them directly and booked it for 4 nights at the end of October. The Location was the reason for me to choose the hotel and definetly the location can not be better than this as it is located at the center of all the historical sights. But when it comes to the rooms i can not say that i have satisfied at all. First of all the rooms are tiny and also the bathroom is one of the smallest i have ever seen which you can not even move inside. When you ask if they have a bigger room or not, the staff told me that it is the biggest room in the hotel but i have just seen the next door is much bigger than our room. As a conclusion i can clearly say that this hotel is overpriced. If you pay that money you can find a hotel with two times bigger rooms and larger showers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Highlandcollie
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Blue House. Great location, the view from the rooftop terrace is fantastic. The buffet breakfast was good. Rooms clean. Staff friendly and helpful. A great base from which to explore Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: InYourTownSoon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Blue House on a return trip to Istanbul following recommendations. I cannot concur with the previous reviews at all. First the hotel is overpriced for what you get - at a cost of 160 Euro per night (145 if you pay cash) I expected better. In fact, you get much better in Paris, Rome, and even other hotels in Istanbul for the same money - so it feels like you are being ripped off. The location is good, if you want to be in the heart of the tourist area of Sultanhamet. The room could only be described as adequate at best. Although the room was small I have no problem with the size - even the tiny bathroom, the issues were that it looked out onto a wall, the AC was inadequate, and housekeeping removed the clean towels from my room while I was out taking a walk prior to 10 am. The staff although not unfriendly were indifferent. The hotel does have a lovely rooftop terrace, but guess what - you cant have breakfast there....instead you sit outside on the ground floor pation next to the tour buses coming in for the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. I am sure that this hotel works fine for some, but its certainly not somewhere I would recommend. Next time I will pay the extra to stay at the Four Seasons if I want to stay in this part of town.

Reviews.Title: “A marvellous stay at the Blue House”
Reviews.Author: Young-at-heart36
Reviews.Content: My friend and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The Blue House Hotel Istanbul, I had stayed in Istanbul before and had twice been for a drink there I liked the friendliness and the feel of the bar and so decided to stay there this time We were not disappointed ,It is in a fantastic position our room had two windows, one overlooked the Bosphorous and the other a beautiful view of The Blue Mosque It is without doubt in the best position for visiting all the Places one should see. The service was impeccable The staff friendly and very helpful, and the cleanliness and standard of the rooms brilliant We could not understand why it is only rated a two star Hotel and would definetly recommend it Perhaps because it has no swimming pool . But then who wants one when there is the whole of Istanbul to explore We would definetly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nsander
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel last week. Despite comments below we felt the room was of a good size. Beds quoted as doubles are far bigger than a UK double. The room was spotless - indeed the whole hotel was very well kept. Staff were exceedingly pleasant and very helpful. The location is ideal for either first time or repeat visitors with only a very short walk up a slight incline to Sultanahmed Square. Breakfast was, as noted below, excellent and very fresh. We didn't eat in the evening here so cannot comment. However, I did go up to the roof terrace one morning and agree that more use could be made of it - spectacular views. Also other similar places in the immediate area seem to use their roofs for breakfasting. We did not find the early morning call to prayer too obtrusive but for someone who has never encountered this it will be quite awakening! [We found two restaurants locally where there is no hassling to view the menu etc - Rumelli (up a lane just over the Blue Mosque end of the Square) and the first restaurant on the lane directly behind the Basilica Cistern.] Would we stay here again - yes. Also note they offer a 10% cash discount.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel; Hated the Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Neilnmarty
Reviews.Content: We concur with all the positive comments on this board. The hotel was beautiful, wonderfully located, and had superior service. We walked in without a reservation--the hotel we had reserved was in the middle of a construction site and very disappointing--and they were able to confirm a room for us when we retured from Ephesus 3 days later. The staff even showed us several rooms to choose from. Back in Istanbul, we decided we wanted to spend one night in Cappadocia--no problem for Mavi Ev. We moved out for one night and then moved back in. No extra fees, no annoyance, just the continued help and friendliess that we found throughtout our stay in Turkey. Our room was small but that was expected. Very clean, great view. For the last 2 days, we splurged and upgraded to the Suite. Not necessary, but we have been used to London and Rome rates for the past few years so it seemed like a bargain. A slight quibble was with the air conditioning. Yes, they have it, but if you like the temperature to be pleasantly frosty, you're not going to get it. They'd probably do better to use a summer cover on the bed, rather than a quilt. But about that Terrace Restaurant! We were a bit turned off by the menu outside (shrimp cocktail?) but the Frommer review was so suberb that we were sucked in. Quite simply, the food was just awful. It reminded me of English hotel food of 30 years ago. We're still mystified by the review which I've seen re-printed in many sources without the Frommer reference, kind of makes you wonder. Yes, the view is wonderful, but half the hotels in Sultanahmet offer the same. I agree with the reader who suggested they keep the terrace open during the day in a more informal way. We spent our evenings at the cafe in front of the Arasta Bazaar (right in front of the hotel) drinking chai, listening to live music (and the dervish at 8 and 10 p.m.) and just taking in the passing scene. Our rating remains a 5. The hotel and the restaurant seem totally unconnected.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-tiny room”
Reviews.Author: deapackedandready
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Blue House (Mavi Ev in Turkish) at the beginning of our trip in Turkey. It is a fabulous location - walking distance to most everything in the old city. The people are friendly, the place is pristine, we enjoyed both the Garden Restaurant in front and the Terras Restaurant on the roof (the views of the Blue Mosque, etc are wonderful), breakfasts are ample and the breakfast room is spacious and sunny, our room was decorated beautifully. But, our room was so small that we could hardly move around. The bathroom was miniscule - the only place to set anything was on the floor. We understand that several of the rooms are "reasonably" sized. So, ask in advance if this is important to you. We had been scheduled for one more night there on our way back through Istanbul, but changed to the Marmara Pera to get more space and be closer to the cruise boat port for our Black Sea cruise.

Reviews.Title: “best value for its location”
Reviews.Author: docwatson_236
Reviews.Content: I stayed at two different hotels in Sultanahmet, which is the prime tourist location for first-time visitors to Istanbul. First I tried out the Four Seasons just up the street, a luxury hotel with, unfortunately, a luxury price. Then, at the recommendation of a seasoned Turkey traveler, I went to the Blue House Hotel, which is superbly located, across from the Blue Mosque. Its rates are half that of the Four Seasons. Nearby are Topkapi Palace, the Archaeological Museum, and Aya Sofia -- all the places tourists absolutely have to visit. The Blue House has an attractive lobby and a rooftop garden restaurant with the best views possible in every direction, but only average food and awful mixed cocktails. Stick with the raki and above all, avoid the martinis! The rooms are comfortable and clean, with great beds and plenty of space. Not with luxury toiletries, but the rooms were certainly good enough for me, and I've stayed in some of the best hotels in the world. The staff is unfailingly friendly and helpful. And if you love coffee, pop into the great little java place across the street -- it has the best cappucino in the area. For its value, I would say the Blue House Hotel is perfect for the first-time tourist who doesn't want to spend $550 bucks a night for a room at the Four Seasons. With the money you save, take a side-trip to Bodrum!
